snippet: The conventional wisdom holds that most companies will move to cloud computing slowly, with a few safe projects. A data storage provider, NetApp, is counting on a coming flood.
abstract: The conventional wisdom holds that most companies will move to cloud computing slowly, with a few safe projects. A data storage provider, NetApp, is counting on a coming flood.
lead_paragraph: NetApp, the second largest provider of data storage equipment, likes its customers. It just wants to have fewer of them.

headline.main: Counting on a Rush to the Cloud
